doc.title: Weather Center
doc.plot: "Weather Center" takes up most of the air time one The Weather Channel. Each edition of "Weather Center" is an hour long and consists of segments such as the Weekly Planner, Lifestyles, and Weekend Outlook. At the top and bottom of the hour, the show takes a look at the current weather of each region of the United States. The meteorologists will focus on any regions that have particularly active weather (such as flood warnings or tornado warnings), while severe weather experts give viewers up to date information. The local forecast is always shown during the 8s of the hour.
